importance.external.permutation

Class PermImportance<E,I>

  • java.lang.Object
    • importance.external.permutation.PermImportance<E,I>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ExternalImportanceIF<E>, ImportanceIF<E>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Average, ChisqOnTwoConfusionTables, KSTestOnTreePredPerfs

    public abstract class PermImportance<E,I>
extends java.lang.Object
implements ExternalImportanceIF<E>
    This class defines feature importance as a comparison between two statistics extracted from the decision trees and their corresponding OOB (e.g. the predictive performance of a tree on its OOB). The first statistic is computed from the original OOB, the second one is computed from a permuted version of the OOB, with a particular variable randomly shuffled.

      • PermImportance

        public PermImportance(Data d,
              java.util.Random rnd,
              PermutationIndexIF<I> permutationIndex)
        This is not intended to be called directly but it has to be called by extending classes.
        Parameters:
        d - the dataset
        rnd - a random number generator used to create permutations of the OOB
        permutationIndex - an object that computes a statistic for one variable in a particular tree

    • Method Detail

      • addStatOfVar

        protected abstract void addStatOfVar(int v,
                I stat,
                int treeId)
        Adds the statistic of variable v computed on one tree. This should be called for each variable on each tree.
        Parameters:
        v - is the column index of the variable in the full dataset
        stat - is the value of the statistic computed on one tree with and without permuting variable v
        treeId - is the id of the current tree
